elements.textContent:
Extreme Heat: Record-breaking temperatures caused by climate change and heat waves.
Drought: Prolonged dry periods due to lack of rainfall, leading to water shortages.
Floods: Overflowing water from heavy rainfall or melting snow, causing widespread damage.
Wildfires: Rapidly spreading fires fueled by dry vegetation and strong winds.
Winter Storms: Severe snowstorms and blizzards causing disruption and freezing temperatures.
Tornadoes and Hurricanes: Rotating storms with high winds and heavy rainfall, causing devastating damage.
